results.title: Toxicity of Atenolol and Propranolol on Rat Heart Mitochondria.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Propranolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D011433 @@@Propranolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ are known as beta receptor blocker drugs.

citations.NLM: Seydi E, Tabbati Y, Pourahmad J. Toxicity of Atenolol and Propranolol on Rat Heart Mitochondria. Drug Res (Stuttg). 2020 Apr;70(4):151-157. PMID: 32120430
citations.BibTeX: @article{32120430, title={Toxicity of Atenolol and Propranolol on Rat Heart Mitochondria.}, author={Seydi E and Tabbati Y and Pourahmad J}, journal={Drug Res (Stuttg)}, volume={70}, number={4}, pages={151-157}}

results.title: Role of beta-Adrenergic Receptors in Stress-Induced Cardiac Injury.
results.text_hl: Blockade of beta1- and beta2-adrenergic receptors (@GENE_FDXR @GENE_79122 @@@AR@@@) led to a decrease in @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@SICI@@@. @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1-AR@@@ antagonists @CHEMICAL_Nebivolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068577 @@@nebivolol@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ almost completely prevented @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@SICI@@@.

citations.NLM: Boshchenko AA, Kurbatov BK, Kilin M, Maslov LN, Naryzhnaya NV, Saushkin VV, Zavadovsky KV, Stepanov IV, Gusakova SV, Birulina YG, Zaitseva TN, Smagliy LV. Role of beta-Adrenergic Receptors in Stress-Induced Cardiac Injury. Bull Exp Biol Med. 2025 Feb 13;():. PMID: 39948180
citations.BibTeX: @article{39948180, title={Role of beta-Adrenergic Receptors in Stress-Induced Cardiac Injury.}, author={Boshchenko AA and Kurbatov BK and Kilin M and Maslov LN and Naryzhnaya NV and Saushkin VV and Zavadovsky KV and Stepanov IV and Gusakova SV and Birulina YG and Zaitseva TN and Smagliy LV}, journal={Bull Exp Biol Med}}

results.title: The role of adrenergic and muscarinic receptors in stress-induced cardiac injury.
results.text_hl: Pretreatment with the selective @GENE_ADRB1 @GENE_24925 @@@beta1-AR@@@ antagonist @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ attenuates stress-induced @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@cardiac contractility dysfunction@@@, but recovery of cardiac contractility is not complete.

citations.NLM: Kurbatov BK, Prokudina ES, Maslov LN, Naryzhnaya NV, Logvinov SV, Gorbunov AS, Mukhomedzyanov AV, Krylatov AV, Voronkov NS, Sementsov AS, Zavadovsky KV, Saushkin VV, Nagarajan RP, Oeltgen PR. The role of adrenergic and muscarinic receptors in stress-induced cardiac injury. Pflugers Arch. 2021 Oct;473(10):1641-1655. PMID: 34245378
citations.BibTeX: @article{34245378, title={The role of adrenergic and muscarinic receptors in stress-induced cardiac injury.}, author={Kurbatov BK and Prokudina ES and Maslov LN and Naryzhnaya NV and Logvinov SV and Gorbunov AS and Mukhomedzyanov AV and Krylatov AV and Voronkov NS and Sementsov AS and Zavadovsky KV and Saushkin VV and Nagarajan RP and Oeltgen PR}, journal={Pflugers Arch}, volume={473}, number={10}, pages={1641-1655}}

results.title: Effects of ivabradine and atenolol on heart rate and heart rate variability in healthy cats over a 24 h period: A pilot study Effects of ivabradine and atenolol on heart rate and heart rate variability in healthy cats over a 24 h period: a pilot study
results.text_hl: In healthy @SPECIES_9685 @@@cats@@@, @CHEMICAL_Ivabradine @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000077550 @@@ivabradine@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ significantly @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@reduced the HR@@@ regardless of excitement and rest; their effects were comparable.

citations.NLM: Ogawa M, Kawamura A, Akabane R, Sakatani A, Miyakawa H, Hsu HH, Miyagawa Y, Takemura N. Effects of ivabradine and atenolol on heart rate and heart rate variability in healthy cats over a 24 h period: A pilot study Effects of ivabradine and atenolol on heart rate and heart rate variability in healthy cats over a 24 h period: a pilot study Vet Rec Open. 2022 Dec;9(1):e28. PMID: 35154785

results.title: Anti-anginal effect of Tenormin (atenolol).
results.text_hl: The anti-anginal effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Tenormin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@) has been examined besides placebo control by single blind method in 20 @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@ischaemic heart disease@@@, suffering from @DISEASE_Angina_Stable @DISEASE_MESH:D060050 @@@stable effort angina@@@ proved by coronarography.

results.title: Monitoring the adverse profile of atenolol--a collaborative study.
results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Atenolol@@@, a cardio selective beta-adrenergic blocker, frequently prescribed in various @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@cardiac ailments@@@, has not been thoroughly investigated for its adverse reaction profile in Indian @SPECIES_9606 @@@patient@@@.

citations.NLM: Garg KC, Singhal KC, Kumar S. Monitoring the adverse profile of atenolol--a collaborative study. Indian J Physiol Pharmacol. 1993 Jul;37(3):213-6. PMID: 8276498

results.title: [Corotenol, its effectiveness and tolerance in light of new studies].
results.text_hl: The effectiveness and tolerance of @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@Corotenol@@@ of Mepha Co. was investigated in two studies under conditions of common ambulatory practice of specialists in internal medicine and general practitioners in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ suffering from mild to moderate @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertension@@@ and/or @<m>DISEASE_Heart_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D006331 @@@ischaemic heart disease@@@.
